title: 104_s1284
content: The Act may be cited as the "NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995" and pertains to the transmission of copies. The NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995 expands distribution definitions to include transmission, amends definitions of "publication" and "transmit," and updates importation regulations to cover both tangible goods and transmission. The NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995 expands distribution definitions to include transmission, amends definitions of "publication" and "transmit," and updates importation regulations to cover both tangible goods and transmission. Exemptions for libraries and the visually impaired are also included. The NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995 expands distribution definitions, amends publication and transmission definitions, and updates importation regulations. It includes exemptions for libraries and the visually impaired, such as allowing three copies or phonorecords for libraries and adding a new section for the visually impaired in Title 17, United States Code. The NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995 includes exemptions for libraries and the visually impaired. A new section, Sec. 108A, allows non-profit organizations to reproduce and distribute literary works in formats for the visually impaired without infringing copyright, provided certain conditions are met. The NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995 includes exemptions for libraries and the visually impaired. A new chapter, CHAPTER 12, is added to Title 17, United States Code, focusing on copyright protection and management systems. The NII Copyright Protection Act of 1995 includes exemptions for libraries and the visually impaired. CHAPTER 12 of Title 17, United States Code, addresses copyright protection and management systems. Section 1201 prohibits the circumvention of copyright protection systems without authorization. Section 1202 prohibits the dissemination of false copyright management information. Section 1202 of the NII Copyright Protection Act prohibits the distribution or import of false copyright management information, including altering or removing such information without authorization. Copyright management information includes author and owner details, usage terms, and conditions. Section 1203 of the NII Copyright Protection Act outlines civil remedies for violations of Section 1201 or 1202. It allows for civil actions in US district courts, granting injunctions, impounding devices, and awarding damages to injured parties. The NII Copyright Protection Act allows for civil actions in US district courts for violations of Section 1201 or 1202. Remedies include injunctions, impounding devices, awarding damages, attorney's fees, and ordering the modification or destruction of violating devices. The NII Copyright Protection Act allows civil actions in US district courts for violations of Section 1201 or 1202. Remedies include injunctions, impounding devices, awarding damages, attorney's fees, and ordering the modification or destruction of violating devices. Damages can be actual damages suffered or statutory damages ranging from $200 to $2,500 per violation. The NII Copyright Protection Act allows civil actions in US district courts for violations of Section 1201 or 1202. A complaining party may elect to recover statutory damages for each violation of section 1202, ranging from $2,500 to $25,000. The court may increase damages up to triple the amount for repeated violations within three years. The court may reduce or remit damages for innocent violations at its discretion. The NII Copyright Protection Act allows civil actions for violations of Section 1201 or 1202. Violators can avoid penalties if they prove they were unaware their actions constituted a violation. Penalties for intentional violations of Section 1202 include fines up to $500,000 or imprisonment up to 5 years. SEC. 5. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The table of sections for chapter 1 of title 17, United States Code, is amended by inserting a new section 108A for limitations on exclusive rights for reproduction for the visually impaired. The table of chapters for title 17 is also amended to include a new chapter 12 for Copyright Protection and Management Systems. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment.
